skill.content:
# ASCIIColors Rich UI Components
ASCIIColors unifies high-level UI components into a single interface.
## Panels Used for grouping content or highlighting alerts.
```python from ascii_colors import ASCIIColors
# Simple panel ASCIIColors.panel("Deployment successful!", title="Success", border_style="green")
# Highly customized panel ASCIIColors.panel( "[bold red]This is a critical warning.[/bold red]", title="[bold yellow]âš Warning[/bold yellow]", border_style="bold yellow", box="round", # "square", "round", "double", "minimal" padding=(1, 2) # (vertical, horizontal) ) ```
## Tables Structured data display with column headers and automatic sizing.
```python from ascii_colors import ASCIIColors
ASCIIColors.table( "Service", "Status", "Latency", rows=[ ["API Gateway", "[green]â— Healthy[/green]", "12ms"], ["Database", "[yellow]â— Degraded[/yellow]", "120ms"], ["Cache", "[red]â— Offline[/red]", "0ms"] ], title="System Health", box="round", show_lines=True ) ```
## Trees Visualizing hierarchical data like file systems or nested configurations.
```python from ascii_colors import ASCIIColors, rich
root = ASCIIColors.tree("ðŸ“ project", style="bold cyan") src = root.add_node("ðŸ“ src") src.add("ðŸ“„ main.py") src.add("ðŸ“„ utils.py") root.add("ðŸ“ tests") root.add("ðŸ“„ README.md")
rich.print(root) ```
## Markdown & Syntax Render full markdown strings or syntax-highlighted code blocks.
```python from ascii_colors import ASCIIColors
# Markdown md = """ # Project Stats - Performance: **Optimal** - Status: `ready` """ ASCIIColors.markdown(md)
# Syntax Highlighting code = "def hello(): print('world')" ASCIIColors.syntax(code, language="python", line_numbers=True) ```
## Columns Displaying items side-by-side.
```python from ascii_colors import ASCIIColors
items = ["Apples", "Oranges", "Bananas", "Grapes"] ASCIIColors.columns(*items, width=20) ```
